{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ptosis refers to the drooping of the upper eyelid. The oculomotor nerve, also known as the third cranial nerve, is responsible for controlling the muscles that raise the eyelid. Therefore, a lesion or damage to the oculomotor nerve could result in ptosis.
